newsitem.title: USA: Netscape probing possible bug in browser.
newsitem.headline: Netscape probing possible bug in browser.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp said on Thursday it is investigating a potential bug found in the beta versions its Internet browser.
The company said it was told by an independent Internet consultant that the bug could, under specific conditions, allow access to files on users' hard drives.
Thursday evening CNN reported that the bug was found in all versions of Netscape's internet browser.
Mike Homer, Netscape's senior vice president of marketing, said the consultant has told them that the bug exists on Navigator II, III and test versions of the Communicator Internet browsers.
Homer said the consultant has refused to provide technical details of the bug.
"Our team is working hard to discover the bug using limited information from various sources," Homer said. "Just like in the past, we'll fix the bug when we find it."
"It is likely to cost the company very little. The engineers will find it and stamp it out immediately," Homer said.
He said if the bug exists, customers will be notified immediately.
